skill.name: Project Scaffolding Wizard
skill.description: IDE-grade project scaffolding wizard for creating new projects with comprehensive configuration. Supports 70+ project types: HTML/CSS websites, React, Next.js, Vue, Astro, Remix, React Native, Flutter, Expo, FastAPI, Django, Express, NestJS, Go/Gin, Rust/Axum, Spring Boot, Hono, Elysia, Chrome Extensions, VS Code Extensions, Tauri desktop apps, serverless functions, and more. Provides WebStorm/PyCharm-level project creation with interactive SDK selection, framework configuration, database setup, and DevOps tooling.
skill.summary: Create fully-configured projects with 70+ frameworks, interactive wizard workflow, and DevOps tooling
skill.author: hmohamed01

security_audit.summary: All 446 static findings are false positives. This is a legitimate project scaffolding tool that generates project files, configuration templates, and documentation. The scanner flagged documentation patterns (backticks in markdown), security guidance examples, and template placeholders as security issues. No malicious behavior, credential exfiltration, or harmful operations detected.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution (220 locations in .md files)
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Scanner flagged backticks in markdown as shell execution. These are code formatting delimiters in documentation files (references/best-practices.md, references/frameworks.md, SKILL.md). No actual command execution occurs.

Scanner flagged algorithm names in project descriptions. These are documentation references (MD5, bcrypt) in security guidance sections explaining what NOT to use. No actual weak crypto implementation exists.

'SAM' in wizard-options.md:948 refers to AWS SAM (Serverless Application Model), not Windows Security Accounts Manager. Security best practices guide explains what files NOT to commit to version control.

Documentation teaches best practices for .env files. Scaffold.py generates .env.example templates with placeholder values (e.g., 'your-api-key-here'). Legitimate scaffolding behavior, not credential access.
subprocess module is imported but never used in the codebase. This is dead code, not command execution.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: CRITICAL heuristic: Code execution + Network + Credential access
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: False alarm triggered by combination of template generation and documentation. No network requests or credential exfiltration occurs during operation. File operations are template writing only.
Path navigation ('../preload/preload.js') is in template strings for Electron project generation. This is generated code content, not runtime path traversal attack.

content.value_statement: Setting up new projects manually takes hours of configuration work. This skill generates fully-configured project structures with your chosen framework, language settings, database configuration, and DevOps tooling in minutes.
actual_capabilities: Creates 70+ project types including React, Next.js, Vue, FastAPI, Django, Go, Rust, and more
Interactive wizard guides you through framework, language, database, and tooling choices
Generates TypeScript configs, ESLint, Prettier, Docker, and GitHub Actions setups
Creates .env.example templates, README, and VS Code workspace settings
Supports Tailwind CSS, testing frameworks, and state management libraries
Configures monorepos with Turborepo, Nx Workspace, or pnpm Workspace
limitations: Does not execute shell commands or install dependencies - generates files only
Does not modify existing projects - creates new projects in specified directory
Does not integrate with external APIs or cloud services during project creation
Generated projects require manual running of package manager install commands

use_cases.title: Quick project bootstrap
use_cases.description: Instantly scaffold a full-stack application with React frontend, FastAPI backend, PostgreSQL database, and Docker configuration.

use_cases.title: API project setup
use_cases.description: Create a production-ready API project with your choice of language, ORM, authentication, and CI/CD pipeline.

use_cases.title: Browser extension starter
use_cases.description: Generate a Chrome, Firefox, or VS Code extension project with manifest, popup, and background scripts configured.

prompt_templates.title: Simple React app
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new React project called my-app with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS

prompt_templates.title: Full-stack project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Next.js full-stack project with PostgreSQL, Prisma ORM, authentication, and Docker support

prompt_templates.title: Backend API
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FastAPI Python project with SQLAlchemy, authentication, testing, and GitHub Actions CI

prompt_templates.title: Complex monorepo
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Turborepo monorepo with React frontend, Node.js backend services, shared packages, and Docker deployment

output_examples.input: Create a React project with TypeScript called my-dashboard
output: Generated package.json with React 18, Vite, and TypeScript
Generated tsconfig.json with strict mode and path aliases
Generated src/App.tsx with basic component structure

output_examples.input: Create a Python CLI tool called data-exporter
output: Generated pyproject.toml with Typer for CLI parsing
Created src/data_exporter/cli.py with main command structure
Added requirements.txt with typer[all] and rich
Created README.md with CLI usage instructions

best_practices: Use consistent naming conventions across all generated projects for easier maintenance
Review generated .env.example files and update placeholder values before deployment
Run package manager install commands immediately after scaffolding to verify dependency resolution
anti_patterns: Avoid scaffolding projects with conflicting configurations (e.g., TypeScript strict mode with loose settings)
Do not skip the testing framework option - generated tests provide baseline coverage
Avoid committing .env files with real credentials - use .env.example templates only

faq.question: What project types are supported?
faq.answer: 70+ types including HTML/CSS, React, Next.js, Vue, Angular, Svelte, React Native, Flutter, FastAPI, Django, Express, NestJS, Go, Rust, Spring Boot, Chrome extensions, VS Code extensions, and serverless functions.

faq.question: Does this install dependencies?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates project files and configuration only. You run package manager commands (npm install, pip install) after scaffolding.

faq.question: Can I modify generated projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Generated projects are standard project structures you can customize with your preferred tools and workflows.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Rust, Java, Kotlin, and Ruby for specific project types like Rails.

faq.question: Does it support monorepos?
faq.answer: Yes. Turborepo, Nx Workspace, and pnpm Workspace configurations are available for multi-package projects.

faq.question: Can I add custom configurations?
faq.answer: The wizard guides you through standard options. For advanced customization, edit generated configuration files after project creation.
